comment.body:
I disagree big time. Then again I have had people try to kill me over things I have posted on the web. And they do have global hit squads that look for leaker's, journalists and anyone who disagrees with there Nazi/Communist/Socialist agenda. If you are on the Left side of the spectrum with is about like hanging out with brain dead cows they don't give a dam about anything and if they see there own shadow in the morning they shit there pants. If you are on the right side of the spectrum politically you have had your face kicked in more than one time on the web and probably are banned on Facebook and Twitter.
When you are forced to sing the tune of (George soros) funded Adolf Hitler the cows will wish they fought back before it was to late. 

Massive Social media advertising is what zeronet needs now. The SJW's don't give a dam about censorship. As long as there hateful offensive racist Nazi rants are allowed to continue they will love every minute of killing off any opposition who hasn't been forced to have a sex change or isn't gay.  Hitler was a latent homosexual Jew. He hated himself and projected it out in the world. Just like the Liberals are doing today. 

It if looks like a duck, talks like a duck, quacks like a duck. 
Its a DAM DUCK!!
I want to try a test site first. I tend to newbe break things to easily. I seem to never get out of a bug hunting mode when it comes to computers. LOL

@Futuretoast: That wave of people will be here soon. However there are some critical bugs on this network. Such as errors in the code that shuts it completely down. I clicked on a site today and about 20 min later zero net was totally down on my system. But the program was still running. If it was not for the fact that I had it running in a shell and I looked at it the network would look to be totally inactive. 

Bugs like that are critical to fix. The durability of the zeronet program itself should be the highest priority. The developers need to do a bug hunting and coding day. Network Stability is the key to a solid user base.
@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: I agree. If your zeronet is not getting any data and it looks like no one is on here your program probably crashed.  Recent bug I have noticed and a really bad one.

@Futuretoast: Get this.. I work with Linux and have been in the open source side of things and I never heard of zeronet until 4 days ago. From a user on minds who is not an open source guy at all. If I had known about it 4 years ago I would have market the hell out of this program. You can complain all you want to but marketing is the key. And the user base is usually lazy about marketing it. If everyone here would just make 1 or more posts a day about zeronet and links to help pages and videos 4 out of 10 people will try it. 

But is zero net ready? Bugs need to be fixed to keep the program stable and running.

It's ok to talk mad and mean at times.  But if you are being sarcastic you might want to note it to people or they take you serous. (Sarc) (Example)..   Btw did you do all of those sites? If so PLEASE point some links on how to learn how to do this. Emacs can only go so far.. Ok wait maybe not but anyway..  Future Thanks For Links...
Do you run both of those?
This must be for Windows users.

@Thunder33345: I cant remember the last time I had a drm issue. Then again I use Linux. Drm is just an excuse to rip off consumers. 99 % of the stuff out there is not even worth pirating.
Lisp was the first programming languages. Now if I can keep my emacs from breaking I will be happy.  Emacs and lisp is the sillypudy of code structures. Love it! Hate it! lol
That looks like a bash shell script I wrote after falling asleep doing a faceplant on the keyboard using Emacs. lol

They can also trace by pixel drop and also by that hidden water mark number that is on every ccd chip. Whoops I let another one out.. Oh vault 7 says so much to so many people. May take me 10 years to read everything but why not.
Everyone of those people being censored could have caused problems with the Google Group think. Always do evil.
@Realjohndoe: This zerome program can replace twitter. I think it is the coolest program on zeronet and not used enough by people.
Congratulations on getting your Microsoft Certification for programming.  Please pay $120 MS licensing fees or we will disable your computer.    (LOL!)

Lisp and Emacs started it all. Sorry Vim! 
You are just a text editor.

@leftside: 
China is pure Evil. Communism must be destroyed in China. And thanks for all the attacks from China. Including the power hack. It is just amazing how deep the Communist Chinese will go to harass Americans.  My motto now is if I see some one from China around me they literally get taken out. They went to far last time and the price will be forever.
@Zboy: Make a plug in.

@leftside: I do not live in China. However to me it looks like they changed the language to have multiple meanings between dialects. And this was the first way the communists took over everything. Communism thrives on Lies and inaccuracy. This is how they have always operated. And they are all controlled by the bankers.

@Zboy: I like the idea and I also hate it. A little pop up can be so annoying at times. However I may also want to use that at times. It should be a plug in or some kind of option for zeronet.  A little check box button saying. Would you like zeronet to alert you when you are leaving zeronet.  Now coding this might be a total nightmare. I dont wright code that is worth anything better than a great laugh for good programmers. I will stick to shell scripting.
They need to blow up the great firewall of China. No one Likes the Communist Chinese. They are rude and arrogant ass holes that think that everything made in America is theirs.

@ulrichard: Hydrogen powered cars output is Oxygen. You don't hear one LibTard talking about that do you.  Hydrogen cars can save the planet. Oh, we cant say that can we. We got to have those massive batteries that will take hundreds of years to get recycled in a land fill.
Please post a link, it looks interesting.
Please post what you find when you do it. I wonder how big it is myself.
@PolarüçÄ‚òòÔ∏èüåøüåæüå¥: That code looks like a spider crawler. I don't think anyone can map out zeronet by its design. I may be wrong though.
So basically you are a just a blob.
We all know that binary is the easiest to code. And easy to move around from machine to machine...  lol

@leftside: It would be the only way to slow down software development and speed up software at the same time. It would create millions of new jobs. Think of the possibilities of extremely reliable computers that run at nearly hardware speed. This could be our future. Join the Binary Force.   LOL!

Another very stupid idea for the mass mind controllers to use against there people for war prophet to keep the controllers in power.  The US should  nuke North Korea and turned it into a glass island.  It would permanently solve the problem that a diplomatic solution would never be able to do.

Nazi Clearnet.  They will ban you just to ban you. Admins all turn into power hungry egotistical mad men/women just to get a dopamine boost when they kill your account. And if anyone has been an admin of any social media it is very easy to fall into the censorship trap. Once you ban one for one offense others will demand more banning and the cycle of censorship ends up killing the host.  
I got a lifetime ban on twitter for animal cruelty comparing David Hogg to a Pig. Serous..

@Kaffie: I got a Lifetime ban on twitter for making fun of David hogg. I made a meme that asked who was smarter the pig or the hog. Twitter banned me. I contacted twitter and they demanded I apologize to Mr Hogg to get my account restored. So I apologized to the pig. Then they life time banned me and said I was guilty of animal cruelty.   

They are INSANE!!!

@Kaffie: I am sure I violated some Twitter ever changing TOS. I dont care I am banning twitter. I dont source it, I dont link to it. I want twitter and facebook to be the next myspace. They are all very poorly run companies that suck data and sell it to the highest bidder online. The only place that is really free speech is zeronet. Its better than minds.com.
I think that it should be legal to do a live partial birth abortions but only for Democrats up to the age of 200 years. Muller would be the top of my partial birth abortion list.
@Geekless: So when you mute a user you will also still distribute there content after muting to others?

Everything is wrong with a non governmental owned central bank that is causing capitalism to be more like a communist system.  We need a new economic model. If not then we need to destroy all current models to remove the power from those who make money from absolutely nothing. Communism looks good on paper but when used in real world applications it is a horrid and brutal system of control.

@Geekless: That is the most bad ass comment I have ever read. And you are 100% correct. To understand your soul one must understand physics. Because God is in the total design of it all. The Ultimate test is finding your place in making changes in yourself so that others can also walk that same path you reflect.

Today is the first day I have seen spam. I am no longer a zeronet spam virgin. Now I do think that there needs to be a delete option. Say I spam this thread. Besides a block being there. There needs to be a delete option for zerome if it is a comment thread. It is nice to have some bad players and see how well zeronet can handle abusive users and to check to see if all the blocks work right, or if we need more or less blocks.

@Kaffie: I can see why you want to create a zeronet user group sort of thing. Ok, I am in. Maybe I can be a creative help to some future coding projects that will help create new code tools that will benefit everyone. I think a good small spam attack is needed to test zeronet ability to deal with it.

@Kaffie: I hate running a block list from other peoples lists. One persons block may be another persons like. So I am stuck verifying everything.  But that is the price you pay for p2p and I like it that way. I got banned on twitter 5 times and finally a lifetime ban for harassing animals on twitter. (Twitter admins are Insane!)
@Geekless: I want a mind download on everything technical about Zeronet. So far I have not found an app for that yet but I am still looking..  lol

@Kaffie: I have 5 Zites that I blocked because the site was not working.  Probably a new user learning zeronet. So things that I block, may not be things that you may want to block. My zernet data directory is about 18 gig so far. And zeronet running on its own is only transferring about 400 mb per day average. That is just so amazing right there. Very low bandwidth usage.  Zeronet is absolutely the future of the web.
@Kaffie: Migrating to python 3.0??

@Geekless: Ah you have noticed. I am a totalitarian Fascist when it comes to my computer software that I run on my computer. In fact everyone is. Come on we use the term Kill process and delete file.. We are all silicon code Nazi's. lol

@Kaffie: I must learn python.  I have some video files that are very large. Like the founder of zeronet ted talk. An absolute must have video to re distribute everywhere. And a couple of security programing videos. I do trim down some sites.  There was a Russian porn one that was huge that keeps crawling in from another zite. I am still looking at how it keeps showing up. Kinda nice to be on the server side of things. Also not kinda nice to be on the server side of things.  (Computers just suck up your time as there data slaves.).. lol

What bothers me about the mute lists is what if some one was just a one day ass hole. And they figured out that what they did was wrong. They are forever on that list of banned users. Everyone has a bad day from time to time or may post content that you absolutely object to. However later on they may post content that is very useful and good. Ultimately I would love to see a timer on a ban list that could be user set. Say (username) posted spam or stupid stuff that I did not like. (Like they got drunk and posted!) I can put them on a time out block. It could be set it up as an hourly block to a month and year block. I think we have all been jerks at one time or another and a timed out block list might be a useful tool.  When time out is finished a notification should be coded that (user) block has reached there time limit.
@Geekless: I cant agree with you more. There are bots on zeronet?
@leftside: I do agree. It is a good option to have.
@Kaffie: True.

@Geekless: The timer idea needs to have a prompt to release the person from a block. And a way to check current posting to see if they are still being bad to the users views. The goal would be to allow a seamless way to mute or block a user for x time and a latest post showing for  review process of that block user when it is time for unblocking.

@leftside: I dont want the person being blocked to know they are being blocked. Reason why is that it will turn into a war or blocking..  

(Example) 
Hey (user X) blocked me because I said _____ and that is wrong. They should never block me because of _____..  

You get the point.  And the reason for blocking can be for anything and who you block is your own business. I dont want to see tools used to create a blocking war between users.

@leftside: Ya and maybe a barcode and a social scoring system and weather they are a member of the Chinese communist party.  The easy way to destroy a decentralized program is within the organization. Right Leftside.. Oh, did I just expose something here?

@Kaffie: I think we need a white hat spammer tester that would do a test on spam posting and clearly noting that they are testing what spamming would do to create fixes for potential problems in the future.  This would mean a new zeronet account for the person doing the testing.
@leftside: LOL Good point.. It all goes down to user choice in the end.

@leftside: I will never trust a script file to identify spam usage of words using a few sed commands with a sort routine based on some flipped out algorithm. That is what got twitter and facbook into trouble. AI is a retarded cockroach and can easily be fooled.

@Styromaniac: I find there comments rather amusing. Anything that can break past the China firewall says allot to the program code. Zeronet has allot of potential. Zeronet education is the key to success with users and zite creators.
Normal trimming of messed up sites is something everyone will need to do some day. Lots of one time post and never log back in sites out there. Learning curve.

@Realjohndoe: Zeronet is the next web model that everyone will be moving to.  This will be the next wild west just like the internet was when it first came out. I was actually a part of that work as well. Zeronet has that same feel of wow.. I just cant explain it. I think we just scratched the surface of p2p and there are allot more possibilities. Good side effects of p2p. Lower bandwidth usage. And redundancy file storage making data even more secure because of its redundancy of storage. It is a design win win on so many levels. Eventually those 3 tb drives we buy will be used for Zeronet web storage. Also for the first time you can carry websites with you that work without internet. Will P2P someday replace the server farms? That sounds totally crazy doesn't it. They said the same thing when the automobile was invented. Zeronet is that ground breaking of merged technologies together creating something totally new. And without Open Source Zeronet would have never had the software code resources to create it. (Now we need a total end to end encryption system that is fast, reliable and secure.)

Just one more reason I like old cars. 
Software = Bugs = Car Crash.  
No thanks I can drive myself.

( like making a 80% audio/video/chat comunication on P2P i'm working on that too...)

@Oncatcoaster: That would kick ass. The clearnet is going insane now. World governments and corporations want it totally shut down. It will fail. Mean while we need a backup web so bad right now. So far zeronet is the only decent working solution. Tor is good but it can be taken down.
Wow that is one ugly site. Like the idea but the site layout looks horrible.

@Piloth The Mack: I am still trying to find a video upload site on zeronet that actually works. Looks like to many people started development of sites and abandoned them. Reminds me of the first wave on the internet.
@Somename666: Thanks.. And It actually worked this time. I was just trying IFS. Site looks good but uploading files breaks.  No documentation on max file size or what kind of files the site supports.

Got to love the CIA operation mockingbird. If you think that the major news networks ever tell the truth you are insane. Soviet Spy Robert Muller is just dancing around like a top. Uranium One Was Classic. That shit sure pissed off the anomaly enough to turn matter into particle dust.

@Kaffie: I need more evidence on Pizzagate. And I will never say to not continue to look into it. I think there is something there if not just a cloaked communication system of satanic ritual abuse going on at Ping Puk. Agent leftside will disagree with me on this.

@Kaffie: I am totally on the same page with you on this. We don't have any solid evidence. My theory is that there was allot of evidence and it was all removed and they went into damage control. Then the opposing side (ping pong) flipped it and projected it out as a tactic of a cover up. The intelligence agencies are doing the pizza coverup. Eventually they will find bodies after the story goes away. And I would never eat at that pizza place. Places like that may serve anything.
What is there encryption system?

@Kaffie: I could not have said it better myself. If there was nothing there they would have just done nothing about the posts. Kinda like I found a restaurant that advertises they sell human meat. I filed a report to the FBI.. Nothing was done. This was 2 years ago. The corruption is so bad in government it is not even funny. Sad but true.
Copyright also kills the marketing of the material as well. Copyright is a massive pain to deal with.
@Styromaniac: I agree.. Fuck copyright laws.. And yes it is a form of censorship that they are trying to use against everyone you uses there material.

@Piloth The Mack: I think if you give a statement in the material re published that the copy right is owned by ____ and is copied for promotional commercial consideration would be good enough. This will give the copy right holder full claim to the material and free advertising to the source of that material.
@Piloth The Mack: Same here. What are the other ones. My favorite is CC creative commons.
We need more Conservatives on Zeronet.

I am still in the 50/50 on the crypto currency. I like it kinda but it is still a fiat currency and the only person who make all the $$ is the creator of the currency. And I would like to be proven wrong on this as well however unfortunately I have been right more often than not.

To me it looks like it is a random.  Some times it is sorted perfectly and other times it goes to total hell and I cant find anything. Small cosmetic things like this add up to over all negative user experience with Zeronet. I am sure it is on some one's todo list.
@leftside: Its glitchy at best. Some loads it is sorted right other times it is not. At best it is 50% working right.

I think they are all like junk bonds. Same thing with money. Eventually both will completely collapse globally. Peple will realize that energy/money units like that are designed to enslave the world and not help it.

That whole bar thing on zero hello needs to be on two separate scrollbars. One for the left and one for the rest of the page. And the page name should be changed to "start zero main page" or something simular to avoid confusion with users. Other user input is welcome here on this idea. The idea is to make small changes in the gui that will make it less confusing for new users to use Zeronet. "Btw, I was a bit confused with this as well." I think it is a translation oops thing..  lol


@nofish:
@Piloth The Mack: You have not seen anything  yet. The development for Zeronet is just starting. The basic structure is made and proven a solid working concept.
@Pexo: My zeronet traffic is up allot this week from last. And I have been using it less. I think this means more users on zeronet.
@Styromaniac: What I hate is when the Left wing Nazi party cales me a Nazi. Anyone that pulls that crap gets an ignore.  I hate the Nazi party and everything they stand for.

@Styromaniac: I have reached the point with the Nazi left that I have Zero tolerance for them at all. It is a shooting war now. I am well armed at all times. And I have never missed a target in the past. I am so good the CIA calls me the Anomaly.  I don't need a gun to hit with devastating accuracy levels.
@Styromaniac: I am in a ptsd moment now. I just saw a photo of Michell Obama naked.  Life will never be the same again. I stll am confused..
@Styromaniac: pubs?

@Styromaniac: Oh cool they are a bunch of SJW's.. lol
I love trashing there reality. As being an X Commie I know all there pressure points.  Logic is #1.. They just crumble on the first punch.

@Kaffie: I could never use a Mac. The os gui is cluttered garbage and you cant modify it or change anything about it. And the cost of a mac is 8x that of a pc and you get less performance out of it. Apple is a total rip off. And don't get me started with that lightning plug. Exposed pins on all sides duplicated so that dirt, grim and you name it can hit that connector. Total garbage design and plugs never lasted more than a year on average. Apple needs to be put in its place as an over priced consumer rip off. Linux is not perfect but it is far better than a Mac. (BTW- I will take a Mac over Windows. Windows is not an operating system. Its just one giant Bug fix that tries to run software.

@Kaffie: I will take my Mate desktop with over 14 virtual desktops over a mac desktop any day of the week. Mac is nothing but a BSD back end with a poor windows manager. Its to bad apple has everything locked down. The Apple Geniuses don't think there users can handle desktop freedom. lol  Apple sucks. (Just a little less than Microshit).

@Kaffie: Some one here on zeronet is probably running Linux or BSD on there apple. I have never tried to do an install of Linux/bsd on any apple device. I am sure it wont be that hard to do. And Linux has some bloated desktops as well. KDE desktop is one. The kde apps are really good the desktop is a piece of garbage.

@Kaffie: Mate is the old gnome 2 desktop. Its very stable and solid but it is more ram than xfce which is also good. Gnome 3 is a mouse rolling desktop icon chaser from one location to another. To much eye candy that kills user productivity. Emacs is also a Linux desktop for users that can remember the most insane keyboard commands to get things done. lol

@Kaffie: There is a ton of software. Maybe not as much as Windows. Ubuntu has the most software ready to be in stalled with packages. Most free software is pretty good. Better Video editing software is one big pushes we have with the community right now. We will eventually make video editing and rendering as easy as saving a small text file to your computer. Best thing to do is just install a Linux distribution. If you don't like it try another one. You will find one you like. And you can still use your mac OS as well. External Linux usb drive. Just boot on the drive. Flash thumb drives are slow usually. I do not expect you to find any. Just please report any bugs if you encounter any. Some bug fixes are as fast as a day or less depending on the Linux distribution. I like BSD but they are very limited on software right now. Remember you can run many android apps on Linux now.
Ok what was your fix. Lots of people seem to have some issues similar to this.

@klu9@zeroid.bit: Wow. That could be a common error to happen with anyone new to zeronet.  Like me.. Thanks for the heads up on what not to do. I do a 24 hour backup on zeronet. If something really goes bad I can go back 24 hours and do a recovery kinda. I have had to use it 3 times so far. I take it you did not make a full backup of zeronet.
@klu9@zeroid.bit: I think I am on all the hubs? They were on a Zite I went to. No idea if it is a good idea or bad idea. I figured the more I was connected to the more reach on the network.
@klu9@zeroid.bit: So if I wanted to run a Hub what do I need to do to run one?  (Eventually this will all click.)
Fantastic article! Or a good copy and paste. Don't care its good.
Just make sure you do a full backup of zeronet. As we can see it is a bit buggy. Or it is suffering with newbie zeronet user syndrome.  lol
@klu9@zeroid.bit: Do you have a link that has the full documentation to running a hub?

@klu9@zeroid.bit: There must be a hub document somewhere. Or maybe it is a headless zeronet.  Meaning zeronet running on another computer remotely.

(The only way to really learn about computers is to break them while learning.)

@klu9@zeroid.bit: Currently Zeronet is either poorly documented, or the user base is making up terms that do not exist in the software. This can cause massive confusion and loose new users and developers. This needs to change.
Twitter is evil. The admins are insane. I was banned for animal hate speech.
They still make flip phones. I will never own a smartphone. I know to much about the back end working's to ever want that device around me. (Unless they make a totally secure phone.)
Never trust any News unless you do fact checks on at least 10 points in each news article from 10 different sources.  You will be surprised what you find out when you do this.
Did they fix the youtube downloading part? I have not been able to download anything from youtube for several months.  Flash video down loader on firefox works for now. Its in the app store.
@klu9@zeroid.bit: Good they may have fixed it. I bet I will need to go manually download it and compile it because my repo's are using the outdated program.

@klu9@zeroid.bit: My version of youtube.dl is 2 versions back. I need to download and compile it. I prefer using a package manager over manually installing software. Things can get messy if you don't sometimes.

@leftside: It is against Youtube tos to download videos. I just borrow them as an unofficial off site backup. Actually it is a good idea to download them now. You never know when your favorite youtube site will be censored for the most stupidest of reasons. Or even none at all.

@Tommykakashi: No I just don't like the government watching ever dam thing I say do speak and buy. That is just called common sense. After learning about how bad things are with privacy I actually went back to using a mechanical typewriter. You should try it. You will notice a difference. In fact try going a week without any computers or internet. Then again I remember when the internet was not here. And 1k computers were considered as huge. And they were. (Core memory rocks!) (Ok that was a joke!)) Core memory would crash if you sneezed in the room sometimes. lol
@weakish: Wait till you get followed and get shot at because you made a political comment that the government did not like. Maybe that will change your mind about how convenient it is.
Try org mode on Emacs. It will do it better and give you more controlled options you can program to what you want.

@leftside: Emacs will do everything you think possible. Look into Melpa and other add ons. Its not easy to use but it will do more than vi or any operating system made. Org mode Rocks.. If you are using vi you can install evil which is a vi emulator that works better than vi. All help instructions are in emacs and it will also create its own help as you change Emacs. Emacs is silly puddy of program code. And remember Emacs was one of the first text editor's. So the terms are really odd and strange because they had no clue what to call them. Emacs goes back to 1974 for the editor and Lisp the program code goes back to the late 1950's. Remember Emacs is not just a text editor it is an operating system.

@weakish: Org mode is built into Emacs and does just about everything.  You may want to change the keyboard map since the default keyboard map on Emacs is a hand killer. The alt and ctrl key will do a carpel tunnel on your hand. Emacs is very complex but well worth learning the mountain learning curve. It also will help you code in any computer language.  http://ergoemacs.org/index.html
Org mode help examples books and more. https://orgmode.org/

Lisp is what you make of the code. To say it does not have problems is to understand why so many other branches of coding structures were inspired from Lisp. Lisp is the Code Daddy of them all. If you understand lisp you will appreciate all the other coding structures.
MS Office is a spy processor. Do a packet sniff and see it talk.

@leftside: Down side to Emacs is that you can break it with the wrong keystroke that is activated. It is far from perfect however it can be re-designed while running it. The source code can be changed while running the program. Good thing! Bad Thing... Emacs is a rabbit hole of code. Lisp is the tunnel it takes you to. And everything forked from it. Its very twisted but true. Emacs is still being developed today. Making it the longest free software project under development. You can also use emacs to connect to zeronet. And don't forget the Emacs web browser.
@PolarüçÄ‚òòÔ∏èüåøüåæüå¥: Lisp = Logical code sludge. Better known as- "Why isn't this working now?"
( ) are lisp end statements. They can be used by bots on social media sites to modify the lisp script file while it is read from a poster.
@PolarüçÄ‚òòÔ∏èüåøüåæüå¥:  (I have a 50/50 relationship with )((Lisp.))    (()) = LOL! )

In the future I will be making a open source gui user template guide. This will relate to making a gui for either programs or a website. I have worked on many projects in the past to help design a very simple easy to use layout. Examples are Gnome 2/ mate and the old kde version 3.3 to 3.6. If you have not seen these desktops you can look for some screen shots in a search engine. 
Its not a design its a philosophy of design that many have adopted over the years. The hardest thing in programming is learning when you hit peak perfection of code. And it is not easy to just stop when you are learning new things to code with. Example is Gnome 2 and Gnome 3. Kde 3 and Kde 4.

@leftside: You can get 9 volts that are rechargeable. They are all just basically 6 AAA batteries in side an enclosed case. You can also make your own capacitors as well. The way to keep the ratings the same is to use the exact same material at the same size. You can find out how to make capacitors on youtube and other sites. 
You may save money on the higher rating caps if you make your own. You will need a regulator circuit to adjust the voltage at the right level. If you make a mistake you could easily fry the device. I would put a fuse in the circuit to ensure that you cant fry it out. Its best to always over design an electronic circuit. It will last longer that way.
